name: TENNNES
description:
TENNNES is a local multiplayer game by Jan Willem Nijman, with audio by Eirik Suhrke.

Originally comissioned by NO QUARTER, TENNNES was later included as a gift for backers of the SPORTSFRIENDS Kickstarter.

Once purchased, you're allowed to distribute the game to your friends!

Here's what people have said about TENNNES:

It's almost as visually minimalistic as Pong, and it has very simple pick-up-and-play controls like Virtua Tennis, but it's tactically much deeper than either of those games. --Bennett Foddy


https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/gutefabrik/sp...

What TENNNES has managed, in its simple glory, is a distillation of both the instinctive brilliance of tennis and the longer metagame that occurs between opponents. -- Nick Dymond

http://forceofhab.it/blog/tennnes-anyone/

Instead of being just a refinement of its source material,Tennnes challenges our expectations of digital games by presenting a set of mechanics with few directions other than its puckish title. -- Charles Pratt

http://gamecenter.nyu.edu/keep-games-weird/ Get the soundtrack:

TENNNES features a brilliant jingle and sound effects by Eirik Suhrke, whose work can be found here: http://www.strotch.net/

The TENNNES music can be found on his Game music 2 compilation: http://phlogiston.bandcamp.com/track/tennnes

Disclaimer:

You're really going to need 2 gamepads to play TENNNES. The game can be played by/against AI, but that's absolutely not the intended experience.

Have fun!
